newsitem.title: JAPAN: All Tokyo corn futures end higher on stronger CBOT.
newsitem.headline: All Tokyo corn futures end higher on stronger CBOT.

text.p: All Tokyo corn futures closed higher on Friday, reflecting price rallies on the Chicago market overnight and the yen's weaker tone against the dollar, local traders said.
Prices were 250 to 380 yen higher, with the benchmark March 1998 contract up 380 yen at 16,090 yen per tonne. The day's volume was 52,734 lots.

All months surged from the opening, as active buying from individual investors emerged, traders said. The buying orders accelerated in the afternoon, they said. The spread between the spot and the distant month was 1,870 yen at the closing.
The spot March contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $3.01 per bushel at 0925 GMT, compared with Thursday's close of $3.00-3/4.
The CBOT soybean futures spot March contract was at $8.20 at 0925 GMT, down from $8.21 at Thursday's close.
